5.4.1.1. Letter of Credit. An irrevocable trade finance letter of credit issued by Distributor's bank, confirmed by a bank  designated by Accuray in all respects and delivered to Accuray upon the acceptance of the Purchase Order  by Accuray. The letter of credit will provide that Accuray can draw against the letter of credit according to the  following schedule:

5.4.1.1.1. US $100,000 (non-refundable but, in case of cancellation of the Purchase Order, automatically applied  to Distributor's next purchase of a System) upon Accuray's acceptance of the Purchase  Order, which must be at least four (4) months prior to the Distributor's proposed shipment  date; and

5.4.1.1.2. Balance upon presentation of documents by Accuray evidencing shipment of the Products to  Distributor or Customer as designated in the Purchase Order.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.4.1.1. Letter of Credit. An irrevocable trade finance letter of credit issued by Distributor's bank, confirmed by a bank  designated by Accuray in all respects and delivered to Accuray upon the acceptance of the Purchase Order  by Accuray. The letter of credit will provide that Accuray can draw against the letter of credit according to the  following schedule:

5.4.1.1.1. US $100,000 (non-refundable and forfeited in case of cancellation of the Purchase Order) upon Accuray's acceptance of the Purchase Order, which must be at least one (1) month prior to the Distributor's proposed shipment date; and

5.4.1.1.2. Balance upon presentation of documents by Accuray evidencing shipment of the Products to  Distributor or Customer as designated in the Purchase Order.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the deposit to be forfeited upon cancellation and shortening the timeframe to one month before shipment could be deemed unreasonable and potentially violate good faith and fair dealing principles, which are implied in many jurisdictions' contract law, especially if the cancellation occurs due to unforeseen circumstances or events outside the distributor's control. Additionally, in some jurisdictions, such a non-refundable and forfeiture clause could be challenged as a penalty clause, particularly if it is disproportionate to the actual damages suffered by Accuray as a result of the cancellation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under contract law; potential violation of laws against penalty clauses.

perturbation.original_text: 4.6.1. Scope of Warranty. Accuray will provide a warranty to each Customer that the Products will be free from material defects and  perform substantially in accordance with the written Specifications provided by Accuray as reflected in the regulatory  clearance at the time of sale for a period of one (1) year following Installation of the Products at Customer's facility, but not  to exceed eighteen (18) months following shipment of such Products to Distributor ("Warranty Period"). "Installation" of  the System shall occur upon completion by Accuray or the entity installing the System, as applicable, of Accuray's  acceptance test procedure demonstrating that the System substantially conforms to the written Specifications. If Accuray  does not perform the Installation, Distributor will notify Accuray in writing within ten (10) days following Installation  (including any testing procedures undertaken by Customer or its installation service provider). In no event shall  Distributor, Customer or their respective agents use the System (or any portion thereof) for any purpose before Installation  thereof without the express written approval of Accuray. Distributor
perturbation.changed_text: 4.6.1. Scope of Warranty. Accuray will provide a warranty to each Customer that the Products will be free from material defects and  perform substantially in accordance with the written Specifications provided by Accuray as reflected in the regulatory  clearance at the time of sale for a period of thirty (30) days following Installation of the Products at Customer's facility, but not to exceed forty-five (45) days following shipment of such Products to Distributor ("Warranty Period"). "Installation" of  the System shall occur upon completion by Accuray or the entity installing the System, as applicable, of Accuray's  acceptance test procedure demonstrating that the System substantially conforms to the written Specifications. If Accuray  does not perform the Installation, Distributor will notify Accuray in writing within five (5) days following Installation  (including any testing procedures undertaken by Customer or its installation service provider). In no event shall  Distributor, Customer or their respective agents use the System (or any portion thereof) for any purpose before Installation  thereof without the express written approval of Accuray. Distributor
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the warranty period to 30 days post-installation and capping it at 45 days post-shipment, and shrinking the installation notification time to 5 days, creates a high risk of rendering the warranty practically useless, especially for complex medical equipment. This change could be viewed as unconscionable and against public policy, violating consumer protection laws in jurisdictions that require reasonable warranties for such products. Additionally, the limited timeframe may contradict implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose, making the contract vulnerable to legal challenges.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer protection laws; implied warranty of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose; unconscionability doctrines.

perturbation.original_text: 2.3.3. Purchase. To purchase Products or Services based on a Quote provided by Accuray, Distributor will issue a purchase order,  which shall include specific references to the quote number of such Quote (the "Purchase Order"). Accuray shall either  accept or reject such Purchase Order within two weeks after receipt thereof, with any failure to approve or disapprove of  such Purchase Order in such period constituting disapproval. Each purchase of Accuray Components and Interfaces shall  be accomplished and a Purchase Order may be accepted by the execution of the Purchase Order by an authorized  representative of Accuray. To the extent of any inconsistency between the Quote and the related Purchase Order, the  terms and conditions of such Quote shall govern and Distributor acknowledges and agrees that Accuray shall not be  bound by any terms, conditions or boilerplate language included in a Distributor purchase order submitted to Accuray.

In addition, stating that if there is any inconsistency between the Quote and the related Purchase Order, the terms and conditions of such Purchase Order shall govern and Accuray acknowledges and agrees that it shall be bound by any terms, conditions or boilerplate language included in a Distributor purchase order submitted to Accuray is again unconscionable.
